title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already open in one editor, and an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor in the workspace, nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
EB: When a file is already open in one editor, and an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor in the workspace, the workbench should display a warning message stating that the file is already opened in another editor and ask if the user wants to continue, or display an error message stating that the file cannot be opened in multiple editors simultaneously.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files. 2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or Wordpad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it. 3. Go to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by simply double clicking on it. 4. Now, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. Note that nothing happens, whereas the workbench should display a warning message indicating that the file is already opened in another editor and asking if the user wants to continue, or an error message indicating that the file cannot be opened in multiple editors simultaneously.
